00046 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00047 #  include "config.h"
00048 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H
00049 
00050 #include <stdio.h>
00051 #include <stdlib.h>
00052 #include <stddef.h>
00053 #include <stdint.h>
00054 #include <stdbool.h>
00055 #include <string.h>
00056 
00057 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00058 
00059 #include "utils/nfc-utils.h"
00060 
00061 #define SAK_FLAG_ATS_SUPPORTED 0x20
00062 
00063 #define MAX_FRAME_LEN 264
00064 
00065 static uint8_t abtRx[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00066 static int szRxBits;
00067 static uint8_t abtRawUid[12];
00068 static uint8_t abtAtqa[2];
00069 static uint8_t abtSak;
00070 static uint8_t abtAts[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00071 static uint8_t szAts = 0;
00072 static size_t szCL = 1;//Always start with Cascade Level 1 (CL1)
00073 static nfc_device *pnd;
00074 
00075 bool    quiet_output = false;
00076 bool    iso_ats_supported = false;
00077 
00078 // ISO14443A Anti-Collision Commands
00079 uint8_t  abtReqa[1] = { 0x26 };
00080 uint8_t  abtSelectAll[2] = { 0x93, 0x20 };
00081 uint8_t  abtSelectTag[9] = { 0x93, 0x70, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
00082 uint8_t  abtRats[4] = { 0xe0, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00 };
00083 uint8_t  abtHalt[4] = { 0x50, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
00084 #define CASCADE_BIT 0x04
00085 
00086 // special unlock command
00087 uint8_t  abtUnlock1[1] = { 0x40 };
00088 uint8_t  abtUnlock2[1] = { 0x43 };
00089 uint8_t  abtWipe[1] = { 0x41 };
00090 uint8_t abtWrite[4] = { 0xa0,  0x00,  0x5f,  0xb1 };
00091 uint8_t abtData[18] = { 0x01,  0x23,  0x45,  0x67,  0x00,  0x08,  0x04,  0x00,  0x46,  0x59,  0x25,  0x58,  0x49,  0x10,  0x23,  0x02,  0x23,  0xeb };
00092 uint8_t abtBlank[18] = { 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x07, 0x80, 0x69, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0x36, 0xCC };
00093 
00094 
00095 static  bool
00096 transmit_bits(const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTxBits)
00097 {
00098   // Show transmitted command
00099   if (!quiet_output) {
00100     printf("Sent bits:     ");
00101     print_hex_bits(pbtTx, szTxBits);
00102   }
00103   // Transmit the bit frame command, we don't use the arbitrary parity feature
00104   if ((szRxBits = nfc_initiator_transceive_bits(pnd, pbtTx, szTxBits, NULL, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), NULL)) < 0)
00105     return false;
00106 
00107   // Show received answer
00108   if (!quiet_output) {
00109     printf("Received bits: ");
00110     print_hex_bits(abtRx, szRxBits);
00111   }
00112   // Succesful transfer
00113   return true;
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 static  bool
00118 transmit_bytes(const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTx)
00119 {
00120   // Show transmitted command
00121   if (!quiet_output) {
00122     printf("Sent bits:     ");
00123     print_hex(pbtTx, szTx);
00124   }
00125   int res;
00126   // Transmit the command bytes
00127   if ((res = nfc_initiator_transceive_bytes(pnd, pbtTx, szTx, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0)
00128     return false;
00129 
00130   // Show received answer
00131   if (!quiet_output) {
00132     printf("Received bits: ");
00133     print_hex(abtRx, res);
00134   }
00135   // Succesful transfer
00136   return true;
00137 }
00138 
00139 static void
00140 print_usage(char *argv[])
00141 {
00142   printf("Usage: %s [OPTIONS] [UID]\n", argv[0]);
00143   printf("Options:\n");
00144   printf("\t-h\tHelp. Print this message.\n");
00145   printf("\t-f\tFormat. Delete all data (set to 0xFF) and reset ACLs to default.\n");
00146   printf("\t-q\tQuiet mode. Suppress output of READER and CARD data (improves timing).\n");
00147   printf("\n\tSpecify UID (4 HEX bytes) to set UID, or leave blank for default '01234567'.\n");
00148   printf("\tThis utility can be used to recover cards that have been damaged by writing bad\n");
00149   printf("\tdata (e.g. wrong BCC), thus making them non-selectable by most tools/readers.\n");
00150   printf("\n\t*** Note: this utility only works with special Mifare 1K cards (Chinese clones).\n\n");
00151 }
00152 
00153 int
00154 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00155 {
00156   int      arg, i;
00157   bool     format = false;
00158   unsigned int c;
00159   char     tmp[3] = { 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
00160 
00161 
00162   // Get commandline options
00163   for (arg = 1; arg < argc; arg++) {
00164     if (0 == strcmp(argv[arg], "-h")) {
00165       print_usage(argv);
00166       exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00167     } else if (0 == strcmp(argv[arg], "-f")) {
00168       format = true;
00169     } else if (0 == strcmp(argv[arg], "-q")) {
00170       quiet_output = true;
00171     } else if (strlen(argv[arg]) == 8) {
00172       for (i = 0 ; i < 4 ; ++i) {
00173         memcpy(tmp, argv[arg] + i * 2, 2);
00174         sscanf(tmp, "%02x", &c);
00175         abtData[i] = (char) c;
00176       }
00177       abtData[4] = abtData[0] ^ abtData[1] ^ abtData[2] ^ abtData[3];
00178       iso14443a_crc_append(abtData, 16);
00179     } else {
00180       ERR("%s is not supported option.", argv[arg]);
00181       print_usage(argv);
00182       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00183     }
00184   }
00185 
00186   nfc_context *context;
00187   nfc_init(&context);
00188   if (context == NULL) {
00189     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00190     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00191   }
00192 
00193   // Try to open the NFC reader
00194   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00195 
00196   if (pnd == NULL) {
00197     ERR("Error opening NFC reader");
00198     nfc_exit(context);
00199     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00200   }
00201 
00202   // Initialise NFC device as "initiator"
00203   if (nfc_initiator_init(pnd) < 0) {
00204     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_initiator_init");
00205     nfc_close(pnd);
00206     nfc_exit(context);
00207     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00208   }
00209 
00210   // Configure the CRC
00211   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_CRC, false) < 0) {
00212     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00213     nfc_close(pnd);
00214     nfc_exit(context);
00215     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00216   }
00217   // Use raw send/receive methods
00218   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, false) < 0) {
00219     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00220     nfc_close(pnd);
00221     nfc_exit(context);
00222     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00223   }
00224   // Disable 14443-4 autoswitching
00225   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_AUTO_ISO14443_4, false) < 0) {
00226     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00227     nfc_close(pnd);
00228     nfc_exit(context);
00229     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00230   }
00231 
00232   printf("NFC reader: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00233 
00234   // Send the 7 bits request command specified in ISO 14443A (0x26)
00235   if (!transmit_bits(abtReqa, 7)) {
00236     printf("Error: No tag available\n");
00237     nfc_close(pnd);
00238     nfc_exit(context);
00239     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00240   }
00241   memcpy(abtAtqa, abtRx, 2);
00242 
00243   // Anti-collision
00244   transmit_bytes(abtSelectAll, 2);
00245 
00246   // Check answer
00247   if ((abtRx[0] ^ abtRx[1] ^ abtRx[2] ^ abtRx[3] ^ abtRx[4]) != 0) {
00248     printf("WARNING: BCC check failed!\n");
00249   }
00250 
00251   // Save the UID CL1
00252   memcpy(abtRawUid, abtRx, 4);
00253 
00254   //Prepare and send CL1 Select-Command
00255   memcpy(abtSelectTag + 2, abtRx, 5);
00256   iso14443a_crc_append(abtSelectTag, 7);
00257   transmit_bytes(abtSelectTag, 9);
00258   abtSak = abtRx[0];
00259 
00260   // Test if we are dealing with a CL2
00261   if (abtSak & CASCADE_BIT) {
00262     szCL = 2;//or more
00263     // Check answer
00264     if (abtRawUid[0] != 0x88) {
00265       printf("WARNING: Cascade bit set but CT != 0x88!\n");
00266     }
00267   }
00268 
00269   if (szCL == 2) {
00270     // We have to do the anti-collision for cascade level 2
00271 
00272     // Prepare CL2 commands
00273     abtSelectAll[0] = 0x95;
00274 
00275     // Anti-collision
00276     transmit_bytes(abtSelectAll, 2);
00277 
00278     // Check answer
00279     if ((abtRx[0] ^ abtRx[1] ^ abtRx[2] ^ abtRx[3] ^ abtRx[4]) != 0) {
00280       printf("WARNING: BCC check failed!\n");
00281     }
00282 
00283     // Save UID CL2
00284     memcpy(abtRawUid + 4, abtRx, 4);
00285 
00286     // Selection
00287     abtSelectTag[0] = 0x95;
00288     memcpy(abtSelectTag + 2, abtRx, 5);
00289     iso14443a_crc_append(abtSelectTag, 7);
00290     transmit_bytes(abtSelectTag, 9);
00291     abtSak = abtRx[0];
00292 
00293     // Test if we are dealing with a CL3
00294     if (abtSak & CASCADE_BIT) {
00295       szCL = 3;
00296       // Check answer
00297       if (abtRawUid[0] != 0x88) {
00298         printf("WARNING: Cascade bit set but CT != 0x88!\n");
00299       }
00300     }
00301 
00302     if (szCL == 3) {
00303       // We have to do the anti-collision for cascade level 3
00304 
00305       // Prepare and send CL3 AC-Command
00306       abtSelectAll[0] = 0x97;
00307       transmit_bytes(abtSelectAll, 2);
00308 
00309       // Check answer
00310       if ((abtRx[0] ^ abtRx[1] ^ abtRx[2] ^ abtRx[3] ^ abtRx[4]) != 0) {
00311         printf("WARNING: BCC check failed!\n");
00312       }
00313 
00314       // Save UID CL3
00315       memcpy(abtRawUid + 8, abtRx, 4);
00316 
00317       // Prepare and send final Select-Command
00318       abtSelectTag[0] = 0x97;
00319       memcpy(abtSelectTag + 2, abtRx, 5);
00320       iso14443a_crc_append(abtSelectTag, 7);
00321       transmit_bytes(abtSelectTag, 9);
00322       abtSak = abtRx[0];
00323     }
00324   }
00325 
00326   // Request ATS, this only applies to tags that support ISO 14443A-4
00327   if (abtRx[0] & SAK_FLAG_ATS_SUPPORTED) {
00328     iso_ats_supported = true;
00329   }
00330 
00331   printf("\nFound tag with\n UID: ");
00332   switch (szCL) {
00333     case 1:
00334       printf("%02x%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[0], abtRawUid[1], abtRawUid[2], abtRawUid[3]);
00335       break;
00336     case 2:
00337       printf("%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[1], abtRawUid[2], abtRawUid[3]);
00338       printf("%02x%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[4], abtRawUid[5], abtRawUid[6], abtRawUid[7]);
00339       break;
00340     case 3:
00341       printf("%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[1], abtRawUid[2], abtRawUid[3]);
00342       printf("%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[5], abtRawUid[6], abtRawUid[7]);
00343       printf("%02x%02x%02x%02x", abtRawUid[8], abtRawUid[9], abtRawUid[10], abtRawUid[11]);
00344       break;
00345   }
00346   printf("\n");
00347   printf("ATQA: %02x%02x\n SAK: %02x\n", abtAtqa[1], abtAtqa[0], abtSak);
00348   if (szAts > 1) { // if = 1, it's not actual ATS but error code
00349     printf(" ATS: ");
00350     print_hex(abtAts, szAts);
00351   }
00352   printf("\n");
00353 
00354   // now reset UID
00355   iso14443a_crc_append(abtHalt, 2);
00356   transmit_bytes(abtHalt, 4);
00357   transmit_bits(abtUnlock1, 7);
00358   if (format) {
00359     transmit_bytes(abtWipe, 1);
00360     transmit_bytes(abtHalt, 4);
00361     transmit_bits(abtUnlock1, 7);
00362   }
00363   transmit_bytes(abtUnlock2, 1);
00364   transmit_bytes(abtWrite, 4);
00365   transmit_bytes(abtData, 18);
00366   if (format) {
00367     for (i = 3 ; i < 64 ; i += 4) {
00368       abtWrite[1] = (char) i;
00369       iso14443a_crc_append(abtWrite, 2);
00370       transmit_bytes(abtWrite, 4);
00371       transmit_bytes(abtBlank, 18);
00372     }
00373   }
00374 
00375   nfc_close(pnd);
00376   nfc_exit(context);
00377   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00378 }
